aboutMe.title: Why did I become a developer you ask?
aboutMe.description: Easy! For the creativity and problem solving. Coding is like a Maxibon, it's better than the sum of its parts, where each part being creativity and problem solving. I love the highs, learn a lot from the lows and find the community and diversity surrounding tech to be like home.

projectList.name: XLR8 Booking System
projectList.what: A booking and admin system for my business. This was my first time ever building anything from scratch. Who said we should start small?!
projectList.why: At the time, we didn't have a booking system, or back-end, to store the large amount of data we were missing. This was the start of that idea, but was put on hold due to external factors.

projectList.name: DLM
projectList.what: A 'fake' web-app that can be used for learners and driving instructors to book driving lessons.
projectList.why: Built for a piece of assessment where we were tasked to build a 2-way marketplace for clients using Ruby on Rails and PostgreSQL.

projectList.name: CSS Avatar
projectList.what: This is my developer account profile picture that I created from CSS.
projectList.why: I was inspired by @flangerhanger's and @jh3yy's epic CSS art they were posting all the time on Twitter, so I gave it a crack.

projectList.name: Calculator
projectList.what: You already know what a calculator does.
projectList.why: I've always wanted to build a calculator and understand how a computer actually calculates 2 numbers. However, I found out that was machine code, which I would love to take a look at one day. In the meantime, here's my simple calculator I built in an afternoon.

projectList.name: PPMv1
projectList.what: An app that finds common artist and songs between friends' Spotify playlists and makes a playlist out of them, and also graphing data about that playlist.
projectList.why: @xxKeefer and I made this web-app for a 2.5 day JavaScript Hackathon, which we ended up winning due to our teamwork, app functionality and code. I focused on the front-end and Keef wrote the back-end.

projectList.name: PPMv2
projectList.what: The V2 of our Spotify Party Playlist Maker (see next project). This time adding Spotify Authentication and also rewriting our V1 functionality into the guest section.
projectList.why: @xxKeefer and I wanted to remake our V1 using the MERN stack for the next Hackathon. We had plans to put more into this 2.5 day app, but when implementing MERN for the first time we came across some hurdles. We placed 2nd this time for our remake, swapping roles this time, where I wrote the back-end and Keef created the front-end with Bulma.

projectList.name: Portfolio V2
projectList.what: My long-time-in-making v2 of my portfolio that is built using React.
projectList.why: Even though I was proud of my 10 day portfolio site (v1) for a Coder Academy assignment (which you can visit by the link in the Copyright in the Contact section), I always knew I wanted to do a rewrite. I hope you like it.

projectList.name: The Curtain Co
projectList.what: Our last piece of assessment required us to build an e-commerce app for a client in a team of 2.
projectList.why: @PeelRasel and I combined all our knowledge and experience, alongside working with a client for the first time, to help turn her business into a reality. This website was created in 1 month across our Christmas break.

blogList.name: ...my weaknesses as a developer
blogList.description: I wanted to document my current situation on what I believe to be my weaknesses as a developer so far. I think it will be a great read in a few years to see how many of these exist still, and what new ones have arised.

blogList.name: ..time management and a bootcamp
blogList.description: How I personally deal with stress and anxiety from the pressure of having 1 million things to do on my mind.

blogList.name: ...my first coherent app
blogList.description: The mini revelation, when writing code, I had in the first few weeks at Coder Academy. It had been a while since I had thought this way so it was great to have my memory jogged about this.

blogList.name: ... a few things I learnt from a ruby terminal app
blogList.description: A few points on things I picked up from my first code sprint that was for our first piece of assessment at Coder Academy. First time writing docs too.

blogList.name: ...a few things I learnt building a portfolio site
blogList.description: A few more pointers I picked up from my experience with building an end product in only CSS/SASS and HTML. When I wrote this description though, my dislike of CSS (even though I love design) has lessened due to CSS frameworks.

blogList.name: ...a *rough* guide on building a CSS avatar
blogList.description: I came across a cool avatar and really wanted to recreate it for my profile picture with only CSS (told you I like design). This is a quick guide on how to build one yourself.
